_publicationTitle: Applying microsatellite multiplex PCR analysis (MMPA) for determining allele copy-number status and percentage of normal cells within tumors.
details: Used for data extraction from MMPA results, requiring automated analysis tool for calculations
contextSnippet: To analyze the data extracted by Peak Scanner software we have developed a tool that automates all the necessary MMPA calculations

_publicationTitle: Applying microsatellite multiplex PCR analysis (MMPA) for determining allele copy-number status and percentage of normal cells within tumors.
details: Calculates Kμ, average percentage of normal tissue contamination, overall AI mechanism, Ks values, AI determination, peak height ratios, and percentage of non-AI cells
contextSnippet: The script calculates and outputs the Kμ, comparing the reactions of control-tumor pairs, the average percentage of normal tissue contamination in the tumor, and the overall mechanism of AI

_publicationTitle: Applying microsatellite multiplex PCR analysis (MMPA) for determining allele copy-number status and percentage of normal cells within tumors.
details: Showed high sensitivity and accuracy with ~82% of microsatellites correctly determining copy-number status and AI-mechanism, ~15% generated out of range values, ~2% indicated incorrect AI-mechanism
contextSnippet: most microsatellites (∼82%) showing AI were correctly determining the copy-number status and the AI-mechanism. ∼15% of microsatellites generated out of range values...The number of microsatellites indicating an incorrect AI-mechanism was very low (∼2%)

_publicationTitle: Applying microsatellite multiplex PCR analysis (MMPA) for determining allele copy-number status and percentage of normal cells within tumors.
details: Correctly determined AI-mechanism in all 27/29 neurofibromas with at least 3 informative AI-microsatellites using criterion allowing discrepancy of 1 AI-microsatellite
contextSnippet: using a criterion that allows the discrepancy of 1 AI-microsatellite, for neurofibromas with at least 3 informative AI-microsatellites (27/29) the MMPA analysis correctly determined the AI-mechanism in all of them

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: Dramatic reduction in HEY and OVCAR8 cell number at 0.1 μM after 72h (p<0.001)
contextSnippet: A dramatic reduction in the number of HEY and OVCAR8 cells was observed at 0.1 μM PF-271 after 72 h ( Fig. 1A , p<0.001).

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: OVCAR3 and IGROV1 growth inhibited at 0.5 μM, A2780 cells growth inhibited at 1 μM (p<0.001)
contextSnippet: With increasing PF-271 concentrations, OVCAR3 and IGROV1 were growth inhibited at 0.5 μM PF-271 and A2780 cells were growth inhibited at 1 μM PF-271 ( Fig. 1A , p<0.001).

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: No significant anchorage-independent growth inhibition of SKOV3, SKOV3-IP, IGROV1-IP, or OVCAR10 cells at 1 μM
contextSnippet: No significant anchorage-independent growth inhibition of SKOV3, SKOV3-IP, IGROV1-IP, or OVCAR10 cells was observed at 1 μM PF-271 ( Fig. 1A ).

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: 0.1 μM treatment for 72h markedly reduced FAK pY397 level in SKOV3-IP, IGROV1, IGROV1-IP, OVCAR10, OVCAR3, HEY, and OVCAR8 cells
contextSnippet: Treatment of cells with 0.1 μM PF-271 for 72 h markedly reduced FAK pY397 level in SKOV3-IP, IGROV1, IGROV1-IP, OVCAR10, OVCAR3, HEY, and OVCAR8 cells ( Fig. 1B ).

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: 0.1 μM treatment did not alter growth of HEY or OVCAR8 cells when cultured adherently on plastic
contextSnippet: when cultured adherently on plastic, 0.1 μM PF-271 treatment did not alter the growth of HEY or OVCAR8 cells under conditions where FAK pY397 was reduced by PF-271 treatment ( Fig. 1C ).

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: ID8-IP growth inhibited by 0.1 μM (p<0.001), but 5009-MOVCAR cell proliferation remained insensitive up to 1 μM over 72h
contextSnippet: ID8-IP growth was inhibited by 0.1 μM PF-271 (p<0.001), but 5009-MOVCAR cell proliferation remained insensitive up to 1 μM PF-271 over 72 h ( Fig. 2A ).

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: Oral administration showed no significant difference in primary tumor weight in 5009-MOVCAR orthotopic model
contextSnippet: Excision and weighing of primary tumors revealed no significant difference ( Fig. 2C ).

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: Less metastatic spread of fluorescently-labeled tumor cells in treated mice (p<0.01)
contextSnippet: However, less metastatic spread of fluorescently-labeled tumor cells was noted in PF-271-treated mice ( Fig. 2D , p<0.01).

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: Significantly reduced FAK Y397 phosphorylation in tumors from treated mice compared to vehicle controls (p<0.001)
contextSnippet: FAK Y397 phosphorylation was high in vehicle-treated tumors compared to normal ovary tissue, and significantly reduced in tumors from PF-271-treated mice compared to vehicle controls ( Fig. 2E , p<0.001).

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: Detected activated FAK pY397 in 7 of 9 control DMSO-treated cell lines, with exceptions being SKOV3 and A2780 cells
contextSnippet: Activated FAK pY397 was detected in 7 of 9 control DMSO-treated cell lines with the exceptions being SKOV3 and A2780 cells.

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: Merlin level was highest in cells insensitive to PF-271 growth inhibition (SKOV3, SKOV3-IP, OVCAR10, IGROV1-IP) and lowest in sensitive cells (HEY and OVCAR8)
contextSnippet: merlin level was highest in cells that were insensitive to PF-271 growth inhibition (SKOV3, SKOV3-IP, OVCAR10, IGROV1-IP) and lowest in cells where PF-271 prevented anchorage-independent cell growth (HEY and OVCAR8).

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: Merlin protein level was elevated in 5009-MOVCAR compared to ID8-IP cells
contextSnippet: Interestingly, merlin protein level was elevated in 5009-MOVCAR compared to ID8-IP cells ( Fig. 2A , inset).

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.

contextSnippet: Stable merlin knockdown was achieved and pooled populations of cells were expanded and analyzed for anchorage-independent growth. Notably, merlin knockdown did not alter the growth of SKOV3-IP and OVCAR10 cells in the presence of 0.1 to 1 μM PF-271

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.

_publicationTitle: Analyses of merlin/NF2 connection to FAK inhibitor responsiveness in serous ovarian cancer.
details: Highly sensitive to PF-271-mediated growth inhibition with dramatic reduction at 0.1 μM after 72h (p<0.001)
contextSnippet: A dramatic reduction in the number of HEY and OVCAR8 cells was observed at 0.1 μM PF-271 after 72 h ( Fig. 1A , p<0.001). These results show that HEY and OVCAR8 cells are highly sensitive to PF-271-mediated growth inhibition.

_publicationTitle: Gene expression analysis identifies potential biomarkers of neurofibromatosis type 1 including adrenomedullin.
details: Contained 3,721 RefSeq IDs corresponding to cataloged proteins, used to identify 132 upregulated transcripts that were secreted or predicted to be secreted
contextSnippet: After importing 3,721 RefSeq IDs corresponding to proteins cataloged in the Secreted Protein Database, we focused on 1,664 transcripts that were upregulated in cells and primary tumors relative to NHSCs

_publicationTitle: Gene expression analysis identifies potential biomarkers of neurofibromatosis type 1 including adrenomedullin.
details: Successfully processed microarray data to identify differentially expressed genes with statistical significance (P < 0.001)
contextSnippet: 132 were similarly upregulated in both neurofibroma-derived Schwann cell cultures and primary tumors and secreted or predicted to be secreted from the Secreted Protein Database, after imposing a P value of 0.001

_publicationTitle: Gene expression analysis identifies potential biomarkers of neurofibromatosis type 1 including adrenomedullin.
details: Successfully designed primers for qPCR validation of 7 out of 13 candidate genes
contextSnippet: Seven of 13 candidates were validated by qPCR (i.e., differentially expressed in neurofibroma Schwann cells (NFSC) and MPNST versus NHSCs at the mRNA level

_publicationTitle: Gene expression analysis identifies potential biomarkers of neurofibromatosis type 1 including adrenomedullin.
details: Successfully validated differential expression of ADM and HGF at RNA level by quantitative qPCR, showing marked upregulation in MPNST cell lines and neurofibroma-derived Schwann cells
contextSnippet: Figure 2 shows the marked upregulation of ADM and HGF in both MPNST cell lines and neurofibroma-derived primary Schwann cells (NF1+/− and NF1−/−) when compared with NHSCs

_publicationTitle: Gene expression analysis identifies potential biomarkers of neurofibromatosis type 1 including adrenomedullin.
details: Secreted ADM at concentrations ranging from 0.152 to 1.072 ng/mL and HGF at concentrations ranging from 0.426 to 25.01 ng/mL in serum-free conditioned medium
contextSnippet: We found that the concentration of ADM in serum-free conditioned medium ranged from 0.152 to 1.072 ng/mL in MPNST cell lines. HGF in MPNST serum-free conditioned medium ranged from 0.426 to 25.01 ng/mL

_publicationTitle: Gene expression analysis identifies potential biomarkers of neurofibromatosis type 1 including adrenomedullin.
details: Migration stimulated 1.5-fold by ADM at 10 μmol/L (P < 0.0001), reduced 1.5-fold by ADM 22-52 antagonist (P = 0.0003), and showed 6-fold increase in migration with serum-free conditioned medium (P < 0.0001)
contextSnippet: The migration of 8814 MPNST cells was stimulated 1.5-fold when ADM at 10 μmol/L was added to DMEM with 10% FBS (P < 0.0001). Adding ADM 22–52 at 10 μmol/L reduced migration by 1.5-fold (P = 0.0003)

_publicationTitle: Gene expression analysis identifies potential biomarkers of neurofibromatosis type 1 including adrenomedullin.
details: Tube formation significantly stimulated by NF1-associated MPNST serum-free conditioned medium (8814) compared to control serum-free DMEM (P < 0.0001), but not by sporadic MPNST conditioned medium
contextSnippet: NF1-associated MPNST serum-free conditioned medium (8814) stimulated more tube formation than the control serum-free DMEM (P < 0.0001). Sporadic MPNST serum-free conditioned medium did not stimulate tube formation compared with serum-free DMEM

_publicationTitle: Gene expression analysis identifies potential biomarkers of neurofibromatosis type 1 including adrenomedullin.
details: Prevented tube formation when HUVECs were exposed to 8814 serum-free conditioned medium, confirming HGF contribution to angiogenesis
contextSnippet: Antagonists of ADM and HGF prevented tube formation when HUVECs were exposed to 8814 serum-free conditioned medium

_publicationTitle: Gene expression analysis identifies potential biomarkers of neurofibromatosis type 1 including adrenomedullin.
details: Detected significantly elevated ADM serum levels in NF1 patients (0.18 ng/mL) versus controls (0.07 ng/mL, P < 0.0001), and higher levels in MPNST patients (0.24 ng/mL) versus pNF patients (0.18 ng/mL, P = 0.03)
contextSnippet: The mean ADM serum concentration in controls was 0.07 ng/mL (n = 25), significantly lower (P < 0.0001) than serum ADM levels in NF1 patients with (n = 17) or without (n = 10) pNF (mean serum ADM concentration of 0.18 ng/mL for both groups)

_publicationTitle: Gene expression analysis identifies potential biomarkers of neurofibromatosis type 1 including adrenomedullin.
details: Showed no significant difference in HGF serum levels between controls (1.1 ng/mL) and NF1 patients with pNF (1.0 ng/mL), without pNF (0.95 ng/mL), or with MPNSTs (1.5 ng/mL)
contextSnippet: HGF was not significantly different in the serum of controls (1.1 ng/mL) compared with NF1 patients with pNF (1.0 ng/mL), NF1 patients without pNF (0.95 ng/mL), or NF1 patients with MPNSTs (1.5 ng/mL)

_publicationTitle: Gene expression analysis identifies potential biomarkers of neurofibromatosis type 1 including adrenomedullin.
details: Successfully quantified tube formation area in HUVEC experiments, enabling statistical comparison between treatment conditions
contextSnippet: Area of tube formation was then compared with that of HUVECs in serum-free DMEM

_publicationTitle: Validity and interexaminer reliability of a new method to quantify skin neurofibromas of neurofibromatosis 1 using paper frames.
details: Excellent interexaminer reliability with ICC of 0.995 (95% CI: 0.992-0.997) between two examiners
contextSnippet: The intraclass correlation coefficient (ICC) showed excellent homogeneity/reliability between the two examiners...ICC 0.995 (0.992 – 0.997)

_publicationTitle: Validity and interexaminer reliability of a new method to quantify skin neurofibromas of neurofibromatosis 1 using paper frames.
details: No statistically significant difference between examiners (P = 0.236) with mean counts of 67.09 vs 66.17 neurofibromas
contextSnippet: There was no statistically significant difference when comparing the general means of the number of neurofibromas obtained from examiner A and examiner B (paired t-test; P = 0.236)

_publicationTitle: Validity and interexaminer reliability of a new method to quantify skin neurofibromas of neurofibromatosis 1 using paper frames.
details: Strong predictive correlation with total neurofibroma count (P <0.0001) with R² = 0.63 for examiner A and R² = 0.64 for examiner B
contextSnippet: There was a statistically significant correlation (P <0.0001) between the average values...using the equation 65.6 + 9.7× for examiner A (R² = 0.63) and the equation 38.6 + 10.3× for examiner B (R² = 0.64)

_publicationTitle: Validity and interexaminer reliability of a new method to quantify skin neurofibromas of neurofibromatosis 1 using paper frames.
details: Agreement >90% achieved at threshold of 10 neurofibromas, ~96% at 20 neurofibromas, and ~100% at 36-40 neurofibromas
contextSnippet: when a threshold of 10 neurofibromas was seen, an agreement higher than 90% could be achieved. When the threshold of 20 neurofibromas was achieved, the agreement between A and B examiners was equal, being around 96%

_publicationTitle: Validity and interexaminer reliability of a new method to quantify skin neurofibromas of neurofibromatosis 1 using paper frames.
details: Proportional bias observed in patients with ≥100 neurofibromas, with fixed bias in patients with <100 neurofibromas
contextSnippet: While in individuals with < 100 neurofibromas there was a fixed bias, counting errors in individuals with ≥ 100 neurofibromas tended to be higher as the number of skin neurofibromas increased (proportional bias)

_publicationTitle: A qualitative study of the impact of plexiform neurofibromas on need fulfilment in adults with neurofibromatosis type 1.
details: Model identified five major themes affecting need fulfillment in NF1 patients with plexiform neurofibromas: appearance, relationships, independence, role fulfillment, and pleasure
contextSnippet: The five major themes derived from the analyses were appearance, relationships, independence, role fulfilment and pleasure. These themes covered all issues identified from the interviews.

_publicationTitle: A qualitative study of the impact of plexiform neurofibromas on need fulfilment in adults with neurofibromatosis type 1.
details: Model captured 696 statements related to impact of plexiform neurofibromas on need fulfillment from patient interviews
contextSnippet: The interview transcripts revealed 696 statements related to the impact of pNFs on need fulfilment. These statements were grouped into specific issues and then merged into broad themes.

_publicationTitle: A qualitative study of the impact of plexiform neurofibromas on need fulfilment in adults with neurofibromatosis type 1.
details: Model demonstrated cross-cultural validity with consistent findings between UK and US patient interviews, with only four country-specific issues identified
contextSnippet: Only four examples were found where a specific issue was raised in one country only...In all other respects, the interviewees in each country raised the same issues when describing the impact of their condition.

_publicationTitle: A qualitative study of the impact of plexiform neurofibromas on need fulfilment in adults with neurofibromatosis type 1.
details: Model provides complementary information to traditional health-related QoL measures, particularly for multi-faceted syndromes like NF1
contextSnippet: An understanding of need fulfilment will complement information generated from traditional health-related QoL measures, particularly in a multi-faceted syndrome such as NF1.

_publicationTitle: Asfotase-α improves bone growth, mineralization and strength in mouse models of neurofibromatosis type-1.
details: BMSCs showed 60-70% lower Nf1 expression compared to WT mice and 70% higher extracellular PPi concentration
contextSnippet: BMSCs from Col2-Nf1 KO mice, lacking Nf1 in osteochondroprogenitor cells, were characterized by a 60–70% lower Nf1 expression compared to WT mice...This lower Nf1 expression level was accompanied by a significant 70% higher extracellular PPI concentration

_publicationTitle: Asfotase-α improves bone growth, mineralization and strength in mouse models of neurofibromatosis type-1.
details: Higher expression of Ank, Enpp1, and Opn mRNA and protein levels in BMSCs compared to WT
contextSnippet: The expression of both Ank and Enpp1 mRNA (Fig. 1c, left and middle panels) and protein levels (Supplementary Fig. 1a) were higher in Nf1–deficient BMSCs compared to WT BMSCs. Osteopontin (Opn) expression was also higher

_publicationTitle: Asfotase-α improves bone growth, mineralization and strength in mouse models of neurofibromatosis type-1.
details: Chondrocyte cultures generated Alcian blue-positive matrix but showed no signs of mineralization, unlike WT cultures
contextSnippet: Col2-Nf1 KO chondrocyte high–density micromass cultures generated a typical Alcian blue–positive matrix but did not show signs of mineralization, in contrast to WT chondrocyte cultures

_publicationTitle: Asfotase-α improves bone growth, mineralization and strength in mouse models of neurofibromatosis type-1.
details: BMSCs displayed significantly lower differentiation potential with reduced CFU-Ob colony number, TNSAP activity, and lower expression of Runx2, Alpl, and Ocn
contextSnippet: BMSCs isolated from Col2-Nf1 KO mice displayed, compared to BMSCs isolated from WT mice, a significantly lower differentiation potential, as measured by lower CFU–Ob colony number, TNSAP activity (Fig. 3a) and lower expression of osteoblast differentiation markers

_publicationTitle: Asfotase-α improves bone growth, mineralization and strength in mouse models of neurofibromatosis type-1.
details: Had normal size, phosphate, calcium and 25OH vitamin D serum concentrations when cre-recombinase was repressed
contextSnippet: Osx–Nf1 mice had a size undistinguishable from WT littermates upon doxycycline administration (i.e. cre–recombinase repression) from conception to day 14...and had normal phosphate, calcium and 25OH vitamin D serum concentrations

_publicationTitle: Asfotase-α improves bone growth, mineralization and strength in mouse models of neurofibromatosis type-1.
details: Following Nf1 ablation at postnatal day 14, developed hyperosteoidosis, low bone mass, higher cortical porosity, lower cortical thickness, and reduced mechanical strength
contextSnippet: Osx–cre–mediated Nf1 ablation in osteoprogenitors at post–natal day 14...caused hyperosteoidosis (Fig. 6b), low bone mass (Fig. 6c), higher femoral diaphyseal cortical porosity (Fig. 6d), lower cortical thickness...and femurs from Osx-Nf1 KO mice were mechanically weaker

_publicationTitle: Asfotase-α improves bone growth, mineralization and strength in mouse models of neurofibromatosis type-1.
details: Increased matrix mineralization in both WT and Col2-Nf1 KO BMSC cultures, with more pronounced relative increase in mutant cultures
contextSnippet: sALP–FcD10 increased matrix mineralization in both genotypes, although the relative increase was more pronounced in cultures from Col2-Nf1 KO versus WT mice

_publicationTitle: Asfotase-α improves bone growth, mineralization and strength in mouse models of neurofibromatosis type-1.
details: In Col2-Nf1 KO mice, caused 73% increase in size, increased vertebral and tibial BMD, increased cortical bone thickness, and expanded tibia metaphyseal envelopes
contextSnippet: Following this short treatment...a significant 73% increase in the size of mutant mice (Fig. 5b) and a clear increase in vertebral and tibial BMD were observed...sALP–FcD10 significantly increased mid–diaphyseal cortical bone thickness

_publicationTitle: Asfotase-α improves bone growth, mineralization and strength in mouse models of neurofibromatosis type-1.
details: In Osx-Nf1 KO mice, significantly increased trabecular BV/TV and moment of inertia, improved femoral stiffness, modulus and peak force
contextSnippet: sALP–FcD10 significantly increased trabecular BV/TV and moment of inertia, assessed by μCT (Fig. 6c and f), as well as femoral stiffness, modulus and peak force, measured by 3–point–bending

_publicationTitle: Asfotase-α improves bone growth, mineralization and strength in mouse models of neurofibromatosis type-1.
details: In Osx-Nf1 KO mice, improved bone mineralization with 73% reduction in osteoid volume, 65% reduction in osteoid surface, 53% decrease in osteoid thickness, and 20% increase in mineral-to-collagen ratio
contextSnippet: sALP–FcD10 improved bone mineralization in Osx-Nf1 KO mice, as measured by a drastic 73% reduction in osteoid volume per bone volume, a 65% reduction in osteoid surface per bone surface, a 53% decrease in osteoid thickness...and a 20% increase in mineral–to–collagen ratio

_publicationTitle: Asfotase-α improves bone growth, mineralization and strength in mouse models of neurofibromatosis type-1.
details: Does not correct the differentiation phenotype of Nf1-deficient osteoblasts despite beneficial effects on mineralization
contextSnippet: further studies will be necessary to determine the evolution and contribution of all the cellular defects typical of Nf1–deficient bone cells...as this drug does not correct the differentiation phenotype of Nf1-deficient osteoblasts

_publicationTitle: Asfotase-α improves bone growth, mineralization and strength in mouse models of neurofibromatosis type-1.
details: BMSCs infected with Cre-expressing adenovirus showed similar changes in gene expression as Col2-Nf1 KO mice, confirming results were not due to reduced osteoprogenitor numbers
contextSnippet: We obtained similar results when comparing Nf1 flox/flox BMSCs cultures infected with a Cre–expressing adenovirus (Nf1–deficient cells) to control cultures infected by a GFP–expressing adenovirus...confirming that the changes in gene expression measured in BMSCs from Col2-Nf1 KO mice were not caused by a reduced number of osteoprogenitors

_publicationTitle: Combined CDK4/6 and ERK1/2 Inhibition Enhances Antitumor Activity in NF1-Associated Plexiform Neurofibroma.
details: Single agent abemaciclib and LY3214996 significantly reduced both proximal nerve root volume and the total number of PNF per mouse
contextSnippet: Single agent abemaciclib and LY3214996 significantly reduced both proximal nerve root volume (Fig. 4D) and the total number of PNF per mouse (Fig. 4E).

_publicationTitle: Combined CDK4/6 and ERK1/2 Inhibition Enhances Antitumor Activity in NF1-Associated Plexiform Neurofibroma.
details: Combination of abemaciclib plus LY3214996 resulted in greater reduction in the number of PNF tumors per mouse compared to either drug alone, with normalization of nerve microarchitecture
contextSnippet: the combination of abemaciclib plus LY3214996 resulted in a greater reduction in the number of PNF tumors per mouse as compared to either drug alone, with normalization of nerve microarchitecture

_publicationTitle: Combined CDK4/6 and ERK1/2 Inhibition Enhances Antitumor Activity in NF1-Associated Plexiform Neurofibroma.
details: Mice treated at 100 mg/kg LY3214996 exhibited excess mortality due to gastroparesis; 50 mg/kg dose showed improved tolerability but still some excess mortality compared to vehicle and abemaciclib
contextSnippet: mice treated at an initial dose of 100 mg/kg LY3214996 exhibited excess mortality due to gastroparesis. Thus, a dose of 50 mg/kg LY3214996 was subsequently used for efficacy studies with considerably improved tolerability

_publicationTitle: Combined CDK4/6 and ERK1/2 Inhibition Enhances Antitumor Activity in NF1-Associated Plexiform Neurofibroma.
details: No increased toxicity observed in combination treated mice relative to LY3214996 monotherapy
contextSnippet: We did not observe increased toxicity in the combination treated mice relative to LY3214996 monotherapy.

_publicationTitle: Combined CDK4/6 and ERK1/2 Inhibition Enhances Antitumor Activity in NF1-Associated Plexiform Neurofibroma.
details: Showed primarily additivity with synergy scores ranging from 5.106 to 9.724 when treated with abemaciclib and LY3214996 combination
contextSnippet: human NF1 Schwann cell lines showed primarily additivity with synergy scores ranging from 5.106 to 9.724 and 2.885 to 7.294 for the ipNF05.5 and ipNF95.6s, respectively

_publicationTitle: Combined CDK4/6 and ERK1/2 Inhibition Enhances Antitumor Activity in NF1-Associated Plexiform Neurofibroma.
details: Showed primarily additivity with synergy scores ranging from 2.885 to 7.294 when treated with abemaciclib and LY3214996 combination
contextSnippet: human NF1 Schwann cell lines showed primarily additivity with synergy scores ranging from 5.106 to 9.724 and 2.885 to 7.294 for the ipNF05.5 and ipNF95.6s, respectively

_publicationTitle: Combined CDK4/6 and ERK1/2 Inhibition Enhances Antitumor Activity in NF1-Associated Plexiform Neurofibroma.
details: Validated increased SPI1 expression in murine PNF by immunohistochemical assays
contextSnippet: including Spi1 and Etv4, which we validated by immunohistochemical assays in murine and human NF1-associated PNF respectively

_publicationTitle: Combined CDK4/6 and ERK1/2 Inhibition Enhances Antitumor Activity in NF1-Associated Plexiform Neurofibroma.
details: Validated increased ETV4 expression in human NF1-associated PNF by immunohistochemical assays
contextSnippet: including Spi1 and Etv4, which we validated by immunohistochemical assays in murine and human NF1-associated PNF respectively

_publicationTitle: Combined CDK4/6 and ERK1/2 Inhibition Enhances Antitumor Activity in NF1-Associated Plexiform Neurofibroma.
details: Revealed increases in CDK6 in human PNF compared to healthy control nerve tissue
contextSnippet: The results revealed increases in CDK6 (Fig. 2G, Supplemental Fig. S5B), CDK4 (Fig. 2H), phospho-Rb (S807/811) (Fig. 2I, Supplemental Fig. S5C)

_publicationTitle: Combined CDK4/6 and ERK1/2 Inhibition Enhances Antitumor Activity in NF1-Associated Plexiform Neurofibroma.
details: Revealed increases in CDK4 in human PNF compared to healthy control nerve tissue
contextSnippet: The results revealed increases in CDK6 (Fig. 2G, Supplemental Fig. S5B), CDK4 (Fig. 2H), phospho-Rb (S807/811) (Fig. 2I, Supplemental Fig. S5C)

_publicationTitle: Combined CDK4/6 and ERK1/2 Inhibition Enhances Antitumor Activity in NF1-Associated Plexiform Neurofibroma.

_publicationTitle: Chemical genetic screens reveal defective lysosomal trafficking as synthetic lethal with NF1 loss.

_publicationTitle: Chemical genetic screens reveal defective lysosomal trafficking as synthetic lethal with NF1 loss.

contextSnippet: Y102 treatment alone did not result in LC3-II accumulation. All treatments with HCQ present resulted in LC3-II accumulation

contextSnippet: Combined ICB was effective and significantly inhibited the growth of PRC2-wt AT3 tumors; in contrast, it failed to retard the growth of PRC2-loss AT3 tumors

contextSnippet: SUZ12 loss led to a global reduction of the H3K27me3, H3K27me2, and H3K27me1 marks and a reciprocal global increase in the H3K27ac mark in PRC2-isogenic human MPNST cells

contextSnippet: We observed that heat-iMVA in PRC2-loss murine tumor cells (AT3 [sg Eed], SKP605 [sg Eed]) not only triggered type I IFN production (e.g., Ifnb1 and Ifna4), but also rescued the PRC2-loss–mediated IFN-γ signaling deficiency

_publicationTitle: Systems Biology Approaches Reveal Potential Phenotype-Modifier Genes in Neurofibromatosis Type 1.

_publicationTitle: Systems Biology Approaches Reveal Potential Phenotype-Modifier Genes in Neurofibromatosis Type 1.
details: Applied network statistics to identify nodes with high betweenness and closeness centrality in a network of 1561 nodes
contextSnippet: To verify the nodes with relevant roles in the information flow from the network assembled in the previous section, systems biology network statistics were applied using Cytoscape v.3.7.2 software.

_publicationTitle: Systems Biology Approaches Reveal Potential Phenotype-Modifier Genes in Neurofibromatosis Type 1.

contextSnippet: In TCGA, we selected seven different types of tumors for which samples with nonsense mutations in NF1 were available. We evaluated tumors that presented NF1 nonsense mutations against tumors with wildtype NF1.

_publicationTitle: Systems Biology Approaches Reveal Potential Phenotype-Modifier Genes in Neurofibromatosis Type 1.

_publicationTitle: Systems Biology Approaches Reveal Potential Phenotype-Modifier Genes in Neurofibromatosis Type 1.

_publicationTitle: Systems Biology Approaches Reveal Potential Phenotype-Modifier Genes in Neurofibromatosis Type 1.

_publicationTitle: Systems Biology Approaches Reveal Potential Phenotype-Modifier Genes in Neurofibromatosis Type 1.

contextSnippet: we suggest two important means of assessing tumor response of NF2-related VS to drug treatment: radiographic tumor response (defined as a 20% reduction in tumor volume) and hearing response (defined as a statistically significant improvement in word recognition score)

_publicationTitle: Suggested response criteria for phase II antitumor drug studies for neurofibromatosis type 2 related vestibular schwannoma.

contextSnippet: some patients might enter an NF2 VS trial because of a growing VS in an only hearing ear with word recognition scores above 94%. Such patients would be ineligible for hearing responses because of the 'ceiling effect' described above

_publicationTitle: Suggested response criteria for phase II antitumor drug studies for neurofibromatosis type 2 related vestibular schwannoma.

details: ATRX knockdown did not increase sensitivity to either ATR inhibition or temozolomide treatment
contextSnippet: In contrast, ATRX knockdown in the ALT-negative, NF1-associated sarcoma line JHH-CRC65 did not increase sensitivity to either ATR inhibition or temozolomide treatment

_publicationTitle: Therapeutic Vulnerability to ATR Inhibition in Concurrent
details: Oral administration of ATR inhibitor AZD6738 decreased growth transiently in ATRX-deficient U251 xenografts, while combination with temozolomide had more pronounced and persistent inhibitory effect
contextSnippet: Oral administration of the ATR inhibitor, AZD6738, decreased growth transiently in ATRX-deficient U251 xenografts, while the combination of temozolomide plus AZD6738 had a more pronounced and persistent inhibitory effect on tumor cell growth

_publicationTitle: Gene signature associated with benign neurofibroma transformation to malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors.

contextSnippet: We also grouped segregated sporadic and NF1-associated MPNST samples from the GSE66743 study, as there were no differentially expressed genes between samples

_publicationTitle: Gene signature associated with benign neurofibroma transformation to malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors.

contextSnippet: In the top two positions was Entinostat MS-275, a histone deacetylase (HDAC) inhibitor selective for class I HDAC. The non-specific HDAC inhibitor Trichostatin A (TSA) appeared in 39 of the top 50 entries retrieved

_publicationTitle: Gene signature associated with benign neurofibroma transformation to malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors.
details: Identified disease signatures with 58% similarity to other cancers, with 73% being solid tumors, particularly prostate and breast cancers, confirming predictive value for therapeutic target identification
contextSnippet: The most similar diseases were other types of cancer (58%), of which 73% were solid tumors, especially in prostate and breast

_publicationTitle: Gene signature associated with benign neurofibroma transformation to malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors.

contextSnippet: genes grouped independently, and dendrograms were determined of the comparisons and of the genes, grouped in 46 clusters represented by their self-organizing tree algorithm (SOTA) centroid vectors

_publicationTitle: Gene signature associated with benign neurofibroma transformation to malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors.
details: Successfully identified 428 differentially methylated gene promoters in MPNST vs. NF comparison and 594 in MPNST vs. control comparison, with most being hypermethylated
contextSnippet: showed 428, 594 and 9 differentially methylated gene promoters, respectively (right columns); most were hypermethylated

_publicationTitle: Gene signature associated with benign neurofibroma transformation to malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors.
details: Successfully performed GO term enrichment analysis identifying DNA replication and cell cycle pathways as shared across three pathway databases for upregulated genes, with 70% of GO terms involved in cell proliferation processes
contextSnippet: DNA replication and cell cycle pathways were shared in the three pathway databases; 70% of GO terms associated to these genes were thus involved mainly in processes that underlie positive regulation of cell proliferation

_publicationTitle: A multicenter study of neurofibromatosis type 1 utilizing deep learning for whole body tumor identification.

_publicationTitle: A multicenter study of neurofibromatosis type 1 utilizing deep learning for whole body tumor identification.
details: Achieved accurate segmentation of PNF/MPNST lesions after 33,000 rounds of training

_publicationTitle: A multicenter study of neurofibromatosis type 1 utilizing deep learning for whole body tumor identification.

_publicationTitle: A multicenter study of neurofibromatosis type 1 utilizing deep learning for whole body tumor identification.
details: Box loss values decreased from 6.27% to 2.79% in training set and from 4.30% to 2.47% in validation

_publicationTitle: A multicenter study of neurofibromatosis type 1 utilizing deep learning for whole body tumor identification.

_publicationTitle: A multicenter study of neurofibromatosis type 1 utilizing deep learning for whole body tumor identification.

_publicationTitle: A multicenter study of neurofibromatosis type 1 utilizing deep learning for whole body tumor identification.

_publicationTitle: A multicenter study of neurofibromatosis type 1 utilizing deep learning for whole body tumor identification.

_publicationTitle: A multicenter study of neurofibromatosis type 1 utilizing deep learning for whole body tumor identification.

_publicationTitle: A multicenter study of neurofibromatosis type 1 utilizing deep learning for whole body tumor identification.

contextSnippet: incorporating information from surrounding normal organs/tissues enhanced diagnostic accuracy from 61.90% to 79.37% for MPNST and from 46.67% to 70% for PNF

_publicationTitle: A multicenter study of neurofibromatosis type 1 utilizing deep learning for whole body tumor identification.

contextSnippet: These mutant mice exhibit increased levels of activated Ras (Ras-GTP) and increased GABA mediated inhibition.

contextSnippet: Learning and memory deficits observed in human Neurofibromatosis type 1 patients have been modeled in a Nf1 gene knock-out murine system showing well characterized spatial learning and memory deficiencies.

_publicationTitle: Cognitive dysfunction in NF1 knock-out mice may result from altered vesicular trafficking of APP/DRD3 complex.

_publicationTitle: Cognitive dysfunction in NF1 knock-out mice may result from altered vesicular trafficking of APP/DRD3 complex.

contextSnippet: Affymetrix microarray fold change values correlate well with the trend of transcript levels calculated through RT-PCR reactions. Though the exact fold change values are not identical, the two assays show consistent trends of regulation.

_publicationTitle: Cognitive dysfunction in NF1 knock-out mice may result from altered vesicular trafficking of APP/DRD3 complex.

contextSnippet: the GeneGo networking software identified direct modulation of Ras activity (here notated H-Ras) by neurofibromin. The networking program also identified neurofibromin as a physical binding partner with both the kinesin heavy chain and amyloid beta precursor protein (APP)

contextSnippet: The GeneGo network development software highlights binding properties between this dopamine receptor and filamin A... The associations between integrins and filamin A and between integrins and APP seen in the GeneGo network links neurofibromin to the dopamine receptor.

_publicationTitle: The scaffold protein KSR1, a novel therapeutic target for the treatment of Merlin-deficient tumors.

_publicationTitle: The scaffold protein KSR1, a novel therapeutic target for the treatment of Merlin-deficient tumors.

contextSnippet: ERK1/2 activity (phosphorylation at Thr202/Tyr204) was significantly reduced after KSR1 knockdown compared to the sh-control ( Fig. 2c&d ).

_publicationTitle: The scaffold protein KSR1, a novel therapeutic target for the treatment of Merlin-deficient tumors.

_publicationTitle: The scaffold protein KSR1, a novel therapeutic target for the treatment of Merlin-deficient tumors.

_publicationTitle: The scaffold protein KSR1, a novel therapeutic target for the treatment of Merlin-deficient tumors.

contextSnippet: knockdown of KSR1 reduces cell proliferation (Ki67 index) induced by GFM by up to 71.5% (shRNA-C). ShRNA-A had a slightly smaller but significant effect (61.7% reduction)

_publicationTitle: The scaffold protein KSR1, a novel therapeutic target for the treatment of Merlin-deficient tumors.

contextSnippet: Ki67 staining and mitotic index quantification shows that knockdown of KSR1 significantly reduced proliferation by up to 87% in KSR1 shRNA-C PDGF treated cells

_publicationTitle: The scaffold protein KSR1, a novel therapeutic target for the treatment of Merlin-deficient tumors.

contextSnippet: knockdown of KSR1 with shRNA-C can significantly increase apoptosis of schwannoma cells and that the combination of shRNA-A and C gave a stronger and more significant effect

_publicationTitle: The scaffold protein KSR1, a novel therapeutic target for the treatment of Merlin-deficient tumors.

contextSnippet: Co-IP data confirmed that indeed, KSR1 forms a complex with Merlin regardless of its Serine 518 phosphorylation status, which is important for Merlin's tumor suppressor role

_publicationTitle: The scaffold protein KSR1, a novel therapeutic target for the treatment of Merlin-deficient tumors.

contextSnippet: Initially, we optimized a protocol that allows cell extraction with high yield and viability coupled to the 10XGenomics technology for scRNA-Seq.

_publicationTitle: Human cutaneous neurofibroma matrisome revealed by single-cell RNA sequencing.

_publicationTitle: Human cutaneous neurofibroma matrisome revealed by single-cell RNA sequencing.

_publicationTitle: Human cutaneous neurofibroma matrisome revealed by single-cell RNA sequencing.

contextSnippet: our scRNA-Seq data confirmed this (Fig. 1 b), while revealing that very few cNF fibroblasts are SMA positive. These data indicate that classic fibrogenic fibroblast markers are rare in cNF.

_publicationTitle: Human cutaneous neurofibroma matrisome revealed by single-cell RNA sequencing.

contextSnippet: fibroblast activated protein (FAP)... markers of activated/cancer-associated fibroblasts... are expressed at very low levels

_publicationTitle: Human cutaneous neurofibroma matrisome revealed by single-cell RNA sequencing.
details: Demonstrated very low expression levels in cutaneous neurofibromas, supporting absence of activated/cancer-associated fibroblasts
contextSnippet: collagen type XI (COL11A1), markers of activated/cancer-associated fibroblasts... are expressed at very low levels

_publicationTitle: Human cutaneous neurofibroma matrisome revealed by single-cell RNA sequencing.

contextSnippet: The presence of collagen VI was validated by immunohistochemistry, strongly suggesting that collagen VI is an important component of neurofibroma

_publicationTitle: Human cutaneous neurofibroma matrisome revealed by single-cell RNA sequencing.

contextSnippet: we profiled the universal fibrogenic expression signature in bulk cNF (n = 5) and their matched normal skin margin (n = 5) by qPCR

_publicationTitle: The impact of a virtual mind-body program on resilience factors among international English-speaking adults with neurofibromatoses: secondary analysis of a randomized clinical trial.
details: Both 3RP-NF and HEP-NF conditions showed statistically significant improvement in MOCS-A total score from baseline to post-intervention, 6-months, and 12-months (p < 0.001 for all comparisons)
contextSnippet: Within groups, both the 3RP-NF and HEP-NF conditions showed statistically significant improvement in the MOCS-A total score between baseline and post-intervention (p < 0.001 for both). These improvements were sustained from baseline to 6-months (p < 0.001 for both) and baseline to 12 months (p < 0.001 for both).

_publicationTitle: The impact of a virtual mind-body program on resilience factors among international English-speaking adults with neurofibromatoses: secondary analysis of a randomized clinical trial.
details: 3RP-NF showed significantly greater improvement compared to HEP-NF in MOCS-A total score from baseline to post-intervention (p < 0.001) and baseline to 6 months (p = 0.004), but not at 12 months
contextSnippet: Between groups, the 3RP-NF condition showed significantly greater improvement compared to the HEP-NF condition in the MOCS-A total score from baseline to post-intervention (p < 0.001) and baseline to 6 months (p = 0.004). There was no significant difference between 3RP-NF and HEP-NF in the MOCS-A total score from baseline to 12 months.

_publicationTitle: The impact of a virtual mind-body program on resilience factors among international English-speaking adults with neurofibromatoses: secondary analysis of a randomized clinical trial.
details: Both 3RP-NF and HEP-NF conditions showed statistically significant improvements in CAMS-R total score from baseline to post-intervention, 6-months, and 12-months (p < 0.001 for all comparisons)
contextSnippet: Within groups, both the 3RP-NF and HEP-NF conditions showed statistically significant improvements in the CAMS-R total score between baseline and post-intervention (p < 0.001 for both). These improvements were sustained between baseline and 6-months (p < 0.001 for both) and baseline and 12-months (p < 0.001 for both).

_publicationTitle: The impact of a virtual mind-body program on resilience factors among international English-speaking adults with neurofibromatoses: secondary analysis of a randomized clinical trial.
details: No significant between group differences in CAMS-R total score between 3RP-NF and HEP-NF at any time point
contextSnippet: There were no significant between group differences in CAMS-R total score between 3RP-NF and HEP-NF at any time point.

_publicationTitle: The impact of a virtual mind-body program on resilience factors among international English-speaking adults with neurofibromatoses: secondary analysis of a randomized clinical trial.
details: Both conditions showed significant improvements in GQ-6 from baseline to post-intervention (p < 0.001 for both), sustained to 6-months for both groups, but only sustained to 12-months for 3RP-NF (p = 0.03)
contextSnippet: Within groups, both the 3RP-NF and HEP-NF conditions showed significant improvements in the GQ-6 total score from baseline to post-intervention (p < 0.001 for both). These improvements were sustained from baseline to 6-months (3RP-NF p = 0.01; HEP-NF p < 0.001). From baseline to 12-months these improvements were only observed for 3RP-NF (p = 0.03).

_publicationTitle: The impact of a virtual mind-body program on resilience factors among international English-speaking adults with neurofibromatoses: secondary analysis of a randomized clinical trial.
details: Both conditions showed significant improvements in LOT from baseline to post-intervention (p < 0.001 for both), sustained to 6-months (p < 0.001 for both) and 12-months (3RP-NF p < 0.001; HEP-NF p = 0.008)
contextSnippet: Within groups, both the 3RP-NF and HEP-NF conditions showed significant improvements in the LOT total score between baseline and post-intervention (p < 0.001 for both). These improvements were sustained from base-line to 6-months (p < 0.001 for both) and from baseline to 12-months (p < 0.001 for the 3RP-NF group and p = 0.008 for the HEP-NF).

_publicationTitle: The impact of a virtual mind-body program on resilience factors among international English-speaking adults with neurofibromatoses: secondary analysis of a randomized clinical trial.

_publicationTitle: The impact of a virtual mind-body program on resilience factors among international English-speaking adults with neurofibromatoses: secondary analysis of a randomized clinical trial.

_publicationTitle: The impact of a virtual mind-body program on resilience factors among international English-speaking adults with neurofibromatoses: secondary analysis of a randomized clinical trial.

_publicationTitle: Magnetic Resonance Fingerprinting to Characterize Childhood and Young Adult Brain Tumors.
details: Median imaging time of 11 minutes including conventional T2-weighted sequence for localization
contextSnippet: The median time required for MRF imaging in all patients was 11 min, including a conventional T2-weighted sequence for localization.

_publicationTitle: Magnetic Resonance Fingerprinting to Characterize Childhood and Young Adult Brain Tumors.
details: MRF-derived T1 and T2 values distinguished solid tumor from contralateral white matter (T1 p=0.0002, T2 p=0.0003)
contextSnippet: Among 19 subjects with measurable tumor and CWM regions, the ST component was distinct from CWM on T1 (p = 0.0002) and T2 (p = 0.0003).

_publicationTitle: Magnetic Resonance Fingerprinting to Characterize Childhood and Young Adult Brain Tumors.
details: T1 and T2 values differed between low-grade and high-grade tumors (T1 p=0.007, T2 p=0.013)
contextSnippet: However, T1 and T2 differed between LGG and HG tumors among 20 subjects with measurable brain tumors (Table 1, 17 LGG, 3 HG tumors: T1 p = 0.007, T2 p = 0.013).

_publicationTitle: Magnetic Resonance Fingerprinting to Characterize Childhood and Young Adult Brain Tumors.
details: Increased T1 >1,701 ms predicted high-grade tumors with 100% accuracy in this cohort
contextSnippet: In this small sample, increased T1 (>1,701 ms) predicted HG tumors perfectly, and so a penalized multivariable logistic regression of T1 and T2 on tumor grade was performed.

_publicationTitle: Magnetic Resonance Fingerprinting to Characterize Childhood and Young Adult Brain Tumors.
details: Peritumor regions were distinguishable from contralateral white matter (T1 p=0.0008, T2 p=0.0084)
contextSnippet: In this group, MRF-derived T1 and T2 values were distinct from CWM (T1 p = 0.0008, T2 p = 0.0084).

_publicationTitle: Magnetic Resonance Fingerprinting to Characterize Childhood and Young Adult Brain Tumors.
details: T1 and T2 values in contralateral white matter remained stable longitudinally (median T1 change 38.3 ms, T2 change 8.41 ms)
contextSnippet: However, T1 and T2 values in CWM remained remarkably stable between first and last scans (change in T1 (median [range]) = 38.3 ms [-61.3 to 97.5 ms], change in T2 = 8.41 ms [-10.0 to 10.33 ms]).

_publicationTitle: Cell of origin and microenvironment contribution for NF1-associated dermal neurofibromas.
details: 4-hydroxy tamoxifen at 1 μM for 48 hours induced complete Cre-mediated recombination in SKPs, with all cells turning blue in X-gal staining
contextSnippet: When SKPs derived from these mice were X-gal stained following a 48 hour exposure to 1 μM 4-hydroxy tamoxifen, they all turned blue

_publicationTitle: Cell of origin and microenvironment contribution for NF1-associated dermal neurofibromas.
details: Nf1-/- SKPs generated plexiform neurofibromas 100% of the time within 2 months when implanted into sciatic nerves, while Nf1+/- SKPs showed no tumor growth
contextSnippet: The autologously transplanted Nf1-/- SKPs gave rise to sciatic plexiform neurofibromas within two months post implantation 100% of the time, whereas the transplanted heterozygous (Nf1+/-) SKPs showed no signs of tumor growth

_publicationTitle: Cell of origin and microenvironment contribution for NF1-associated dermal neurofibromas.
details: ROSA26 reporter system successfully demonstrated recombination efficiency and tumor cell origin through X-gal staining, confirming tumors derived from transplanted SKPs
contextSnippet: X-gal staining of the tumors demonstrated that the tumor cells were LacZ-positive and we further demonstrated that the tumor cells had undergone loss of heterozygosity (LOH) for the Nf1 locus

_publicationTitle: Cell of origin and microenvironment contribution for NF1-associated dermal neurofibromas.
details: S100β expression confirmed Schwann cell identity in neurofibromas derived from Nf1-deficient SKPs, consistent with human plexiform neurofibromas
contextSnippet: The neurofibromas exhibited the characteristics of human plexiform neurofibromas, being poorly circumscribed, composed primarily of spindle cells, and expressing the Schwann cell marker S100β

_publicationTitle: Cell of origin and microenvironment contribution for NF1-associated dermal neurofibromas.
details: Nf1-deficient SKPs generated dermal neurofibromas within 3-4 months in pregnant female mice but not in male mice, demonstrating hormonal influence on tumorigenesis
contextSnippet: Strikingly, only the female mice, but not the male mice, developed cutaneous nodules at the graft site within three to four months post SKP implantation

_publicationTitle: Cell of origin and microenvironment contribution for NF1-associated dermal neurofibromas.
details: SKPs can be propagated in vitro for more than five passages under undifferentiated conditions and differentiate into neural crest derivatives including Schwann cells, neurons and adipocytes
contextSnippet: SKPs can be propagated in vitro under 'undifferentiated' conditions for more than five passages and exhibit a surface marker expression profile similar to that of adult neural stem cells

_publicationTitle: Cell of origin and microenvironment contribution for NF1-associated dermal neurofibromas.
details: GFAP expression confirmed neural stem cell characteristics of SKPs, similar to adult neural stem cells from brain dentate gyrus or subventricular zone
contextSnippet: exhibit a surface marker expression profile similar to that of adult neural stem cells derived from brain dentate gyrus or subventricular zone, including nestin and glial fibrillary acidic protein (GFAP)

_publicationTitle: Cell of origin and microenvironment contribution for NF1-associated dermal neurofibromas.
details: Nestin expression confirmed neural stem cell characteristics of SKPs, similar to adult neural stem cells from brain dentate gyrus or subventricular zone
contextSnippet: exhibit a surface marker expression profile similar to that of adult neural stem cells derived from brain dentate gyrus or subventricular zone, including nestin and glial fibrillary acidic protein (GFAP)

_publicationTitle: Cell of origin and microenvironment contribution for NF1-associated dermal neurofibromas.
details: GAP43 immunohistochemistry confirmed Schwann cell markers in dermal neurofibromas derived from Nf1-deficient SKPs in pregnant female mice
contextSnippet: Paraffin sections were assessed with S100β and GAP43 immunohistochemistry (Schwann cell markers), and Leder (mast cell) and H&E staining

_publicationTitle: Cell of origin and microenvironment contribution for NF1-associated dermal neurofibromas.

contextSnippet: We do observe Dhh protein expression in SKPs although the level of expression is variable between samples

_publicationTitle: Genetic diagnosis of neurofibromatosis type 1: targeted next- generation sequencing with Multiple Ligation-Dependent Probe Amplification analysis.
details: Successfully identified 73 NF1 mutations and 2 BRAF novel variants from targeted NGS gene panel screening of 100 individuals
contextSnippet: Among these individuals, we have identified seventy-three NF1 mutations (Table 2) and two BRAF novel variants from a targeted NGS gene panel of NF1/KRAS/BRAF/p53 and SPRED1 analyses.

_publicationTitle: Genetic diagnosis of neurofibromatosis type 1: targeted next- generation sequencing with Multiple Ligation-Dependent Probe Amplification analysis.
details: Successfully predicted damaging effects for multiple amino acid substitutions, with results ranging from 'Tolerated' to 'Damaging' across analyzed variants
contextSnippet: Variants with amino acid changes were further examined to check if the changes were potentially damaging alterations using Sorting Intolerant from Tolerant (SIFT) algorithm

_publicationTitle: Genetic diagnosis of neurofibromatosis type 1: targeted next- generation sequencing with Multiple Ligation-Dependent Probe Amplification analysis.
details: Successfully predicted protein impact with classifications including 'Benign', 'Possibly damaging', and 'Damaging' for amino acid substitutions
contextSnippet: Polymorphism Phenotyping v2 (PolyPhen2) software, which can predict the possible impact of an amino acid substitution on the structure and function of a protein

_publicationTitle: Genetic diagnosis of neurofibromatosis type 1: targeted next- generation sequencing with Multiple Ligation-Dependent Probe Amplification analysis.
details: Successfully detected 18 multi-exon deletions including 3 whole NF1 gene deletions and 15 partial multi-exon deletions in patients with no mutations detected by NGS
contextSnippet: Whole NF1 gene deletions were found in three patients and fifteen multi-exon deletions within the NF1 gene were obtained in this cohort of NF1 patients

_publicationTitle: Genetic diagnosis of neurofibromatosis type 1: targeted next- generation sequencing with Multiple Ligation-Dependent Probe Amplification analysis.
details: Successfully performed peak area normalization and gene dosage calculation with deletion threshold of <0.7 relative peak area value
contextSnippet: we used the Coffalyser program (version 3.5) for peak area normalization and gene dosage calculation. Two copies of the genome have a relative peak area value of approximately 1.0. A reduction in the peak area value to < 0.7 indicates the occurrence of a deletion

_publicationTitle: Genetic diagnosis of neurofibromatosis type 1: targeted next- generation sequencing with Multiple Ligation-Dependent Probe Amplification analysis.
details: Successfully confirmed mutations identified by NGS through Sanger sequencing validation
contextSnippet: Some represented results of Sanger sequencing at the mutation site with blood sample

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.

contextSnippet: 7 of the 10 most sensitive cell lines (average EC 50 = 0.24 μM) lack Merlin protein expression...Among the 37 less sensitive cell lines (average EC 50 = 1.85 μM)

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.
details: 25 mg/kg orally twice daily caused significantly smaller tumors (p=0.006) in MDA-MB-231 xenografts after 29 days
contextSnippet: mice dosed orally twice daily with VS-4718 at 25 mg/kg had significantly smaller tumors (p=0.006) than mice receiving vehicle control after 29 days

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.
details: 100 mg/kg caused tumor regression (p<0.0001) in MDA-MB-231 xenografts
contextSnippet: tumor regression was observed in mice treated with 100 mg/kg VS-4718 (p< 0.0001)

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.
details: Average EC50 of ~3.5 μM in Merlin-positive MPM cell lines vs 0.3 μM in Merlin-negative MPM cell lines
contextSnippet: Merlin-positive MPM cell lines exhibited an average EC 50 of ~3.5 μM, while the average EC 50 for Merlin-negative MPM cell lines was 0.3 μM

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.

contextSnippet: tumor burden in the lungs of VS-4718-treated animals averaged 3.5-fold less than in the lungs of vehicle control-treated animals (p<0.0001)

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.

contextSnippet: with corresponding significant reduction of tumor FAK (pY397) autophosphorylation (p=0.03)

contextSnippet: We observed 2–3 fold induction of caspase3/7 activity in response to VS-4718 treatment in a panel of human Merlin-negative MPM cell lines...with only weak caspase3/7 activation in Merlin-positive

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.

contextSnippet: we observed reduced AKT activation (pAKT-S473) in Merlin-negative Mero-41 and Mero-48a cells sustained for 48 hrs, whereas no inhibition of AKT activation was detected in Merlin-positive

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.

contextSnippet: VS-4718 treatment reduced the percentage of Aldefluor+ cells in direct contrast with the standard cytotoxic agents, which enriched the Aldefluor+ cell subpopulation

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.

contextSnippet: In vitro, MDA-MB-231 cells were >60 fold more sensitive to VS-4718 than MDA-MB-468 cells

contextSnippet: Final average tumor weights in VS-4718 treated groups were reduced only by ~30% relative to the vehicle control group despite significant inhibition of tumor pFAK-Y397 (p=0.0002)

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.

contextSnippet: No significant change in tumor burden was observed in Merlin-positive MSTO-211H xenografts treated with VS-4718 orally twice daily at 75 mg/kg for 11 days...despite ~67% inhibition of tumor FAK-Y397 phosphorylation

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.

contextSnippet: Cell growth inhibition analysis demonstrated decreased sensitivity of MM87 MPM cells and MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cells expressing NF2-GFP to VS-4718...The VS-4718 EC 50 in control MM87/GFP cells was ~300 nM, while in MM87/NF2-GFP cells the EC 50 was increased by approximately 3-fold

_publicationTitle: Merlin deficiency predicts FAK inhibitor sensitivity: a synthetic lethal relationship.

contextSnippet: Treatment of MPM cell lines with FAK siRNA resulted in reduction of FAK mRNA levels by 89–93%...Ki67 staining was reduced approximately 3.5-fold in Merlin-negative Mero-41 cells

contextSnippet: Dhh-Cre; Nf1 treated with PLX3397 (n = 14) had larger benign neurofibromas compared to controls (n = 12). A Mann-Whitney test confirmed significant difference between treated and untreated neurofibromas

_publicationTitle: Neurofibroma-associated macrophages play roles in tumor growth and response to pharmacological inhibition.

contextSnippet: PLX3397 was well tolerated; no animals showed weight loss or morbidity

_publicationTitle: Neurofibroma-associated macrophages play roles in tumor growth and response to pharmacological inhibition.

_publicationTitle: Recommendations for assessing appearance concerns related to plexiform and cutaneous neurofibromas in neurofibromatosis 1 clinical trials.
details: High reliability with Pearson Separation Index values ≥0.83 with and without extremes, and Cronbach alpha values ≥0.87 with and without extremes
contextSnippet: The reliability of the health-related quality of life scales, including Appearance Distress, was high with Pearson Separation Index values ≥0.83 with and without extremes, and Cronbach alpha values ≥0.87 with and without extremes.

_publicationTitle: Recommendations for assessing appearance concerns related to plexiform and cutaneous neurofibromas in neurofibromatosis 1 clinical trials.
details: Validity supported by moderate correlations (r = .37–.59) with specific facial appearance ratings and higher correlations between scales within domains
contextSnippet: The validity of the Appearance Distress scores was supported by moderate correlations (r = .37–.59) with the specific facial appearance ratings and higher correlations between scales within domains

_publicationTitle: Recommendations for assessing appearance concerns related to plexiform and cutaneous neurofibromas in neurofibromatosis 1 clinical trials.
details: Developed and validated in large sample of 1,495 participants, including 31 with NF1 (2.9%)
contextSnippet: The authors conducted rigorous qualitative research to develop the content of the scales followed by Rasch measurement theory analysis to evaluate its psychometric properties in a large sample of 1,495 participants, including 31 with NF1 (2.9%).

_publicationTitle: Recommendations for assessing appearance concerns related to plexiform and cutaneous neurofibromas in neurofibromatosis 1 clinical trials.
details: 8 items rated on 4-point scale (1=always to 4=never), scores converted to 0-100 metric with higher scores indicating better outcomes
contextSnippet: The Appearance Distress scale of this module consists of 8 items rated on a 4-point scale (1=always to 4=never)...Scores on each item are summed to produce a total raw score, which is converted to a 0–100 metric derived from Rasch analysis. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.

details: Registry contained 4680 participants who met data curation criteria, with 6504 survey sessions completed from inception (June 10, 2012) to October 9, 2015
contextSnippet: a rigorous statistical analysis was carried out on a subset of 4680 participants who met data curation criteria based on current practice for their disorder. This dataset contained records from the inception of the registry on June 10, 2012, to October 9, 2015. The 4680 participants had completed 6504 survey sessions.

_publicationTitle: Characterization and utilization of an international neurofibromatosis web-based, patient-entered registry: An observational study.
details: 74% of follow-up sessions were completed within 30 days of receiving reminder emails, with decreasing response rates for subsequent sessions (79% for 2nd, 69% for 3rd, 61% for 4th, 36% for 5th sessions)
contextSnippet: overall, 74% of 1279 sessions subsequent to the first were made within 30 days of receiving a reminder. The strength of this association decreased with increasing numbers of sessions. Thus, 79% of second sessions, 69% of third sessions, 61% of 4th sessions and 36% of 5th sessions were made within 30 days of a reminder.

_publicationTitle: Characterization and utilization of an international neurofibromatosis web-based, patient-entered registry: An observational study.
details: Registry has been useful for recruitment of 14 observational and 4 interventional trials, particularly for development of patient-reported outcomes
contextSnippet: To date, the database has supported geographically diverse recruitment for 14 observational and 4 interventional trials. From the analyses, we postulate that although self-reported, the incidences of NF manifestations in registrants are broadly comparable to what has been reported in clinician-reported databases.

_publicationTitle: Aberrant ATRX protein expression is associated with poor overall survival in NF1-MPNST.
details: 57% (43/74) of MPNSTs showed aberrant ATRX protein expression compared to only 7% (2/30) of plexiform and atypical neurofibromas (p < 0.0001)
contextSnippet: only 7% (2/30) of plexiform neurofibromas and atypical neurofibromas show aberrant ATRX protein expression (Figure 2), compared to 57% (43/74) of MPNSTs showing aberrant ATRX protein (Figure 3, p < 0.0001, Fisher's Exact Test)

_publicationTitle: Aberrant ATRX protein expression is associated with poor overall survival in NF1-MPNST.
details: MPNSTs classified into three immunohistochemical staining patterns: retained (31 tumors), mosaic (29 tumors), or complete loss (14 tumors)
contextSnippet: MPNSTs fell into three groups by immunohistochemical staining: retained, mosaic, or complete loss (Figure 1). This is similar to what has been previously published in adult diffuse gliomas

_publicationTitle: Aberrant ATRX protein expression is associated with poor overall survival in NF1-MPNST.
details: Aberrant ATRX expression significantly associated with worse overall survival in NF1-MPNSTs (p = 0.0276) but not in sporadic MPNSTs (p = 0.4570)
contextSnippet: we did observe a statistically significant decrease in OS for patients with NF1-MPNSTs who have aberrant ATRX expression (Figure 4B, p = 0.0276, log rank test), but there is no difference in overall survival based on ATRX status for sporadic MPNSTs

_publicationTitle: Aberrant ATRX protein expression is associated with poor overall survival in NF1-MPNST.
details: Aberrant ATRX expression was independent poor prognostic factor in NF1-MPNSTs with hazard ratio of 5.3 (95%CI:1.367–20.433)
contextSnippet: aberrant ATRX expression was found to be an independent poor prognostic factor with a hazard ratio of 5.3 (95%CI:1.367–20.433)

_publicationTitle: Aberrant ATRX protein expression is associated with poor overall survival in NF1-MPNST.
details: Used for survival analysis showing significant difference in overall survival for NF1-MPNSTs with aberrant ATRX expression (p = 0.0276)
contextSnippet: we did observe a statistically significant decrease in OS for patients with NF1-MPNSTs who have aberrant ATRX expression (Figure 4B, p = 0.0276, log rank test)

_publicationTitle: Aberrant ATRX protein expression is associated with poor overall survival in NF1-MPNST.
details: Used for multivariate analysis identifying aberrant ATRX expression as independent poor prognostic factor with hazard ratio of 5.3
contextSnippet: In a multivariate analysis of NF1-MPNSTs which evaluated margin status, adjuvant and neoadjuvant treatment, age, initial tumor size, presence of metastasis at diagnosis, initial location of the tumor, and gender, aberrant ATRX expression was found to be an independent poor prognostic factor

_publicationTitle: Modelling neurofibromatosis type 1 tibial dysplasia and its treatment with lovastatin.
details: 40% reduction in bone volume to total volume fraction (BV/TV) in bone marrow cavity (0.086 ± 0.034 versus 0.051 ± 0.005) and five-fold reduction in cortical regions (0.028 ± 0.015 versus 0.004 ± 0.007) at day 7 post injury compared to controls

_publicationTitle: Modelling neurofibromatosis type 1 tibial dysplasia and its treatment with lovastatin.

_publicationTitle: Modelling neurofibromatosis type 1 tibial dysplasia and its treatment with lovastatin.

_publicationTitle: Modelling neurofibromatosis type 1 tibial dysplasia and its treatment with lovastatin.
details: Delayed osteoblast differentiation and retardation of repair process, with ectopic cartilage formation and expansion of spindle-shaped connective tissue fibroblasts
contextSnippet: In contrast, Nf1 deficiency results in delayed osteoblast differentiation, leading to a retardation of the repair process. This is paralleled by ectopic cartilage formation as well as an expansion of spindle-shaped connective tissue fibroblasts

contextSnippet: Krox20;Nf1flox/flox recipients engrafted with heterozygous Nf1+/− bone marrow began to exhibit motor paralysis, weight loss and only 15% of mice survived
